Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the speed at which the Chinese government is building the hospital. While it is true that the government is aiming to construct the hospital in 10 days, the claim may make it seem more extraordinary than it actually is.
Understate: There is no indication of any understatement bias in the claim. The claim accurately states that the Chinese government is building a hospital in 10 days.
Lack enough support: The claim is supported by various pieces of evidence, including photographs and reports from reputable sources. Therefore, there is no bias towards lacking enough support.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in the claim. The claim simply states that the Chinese government is building a hospital in 10 days to deal with the new coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: There is no problematic assumption bias in the claim. It is a straightforward statement about the Chinese government's actions.
Contradict fact: There is no contradiction of fact bias in the claim. The claim accurately reflects the reported actions of the Chinese government.
Falters at times: There is no indication of any faltering bias in the claim. The claim is clear and consistent in stating the Chinese government's plan to build a hospital in 10 days.
